title: 113_s2679
content:
The Act titled "Superfund Polluter Pays Restoration Act of 2014" extends and modifies Superfund excise taxes. The Hazardous Substance Superfund financing rate under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to apply after December 31, 1986, and before January 1, 1996, and after the enactment of the Superfund Polluter Pays Restoration Act of 2014. The modification increases the rate from 9.7 cents to 15.8 cents, with an inflation adjustment for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2014. The Hazardous Substance Superfund financing rate under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase the rate from 9.7 cents to 15.8 cents, with an inflation adjustment for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2014. Amendment to section 4661(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 changes the tax amount imposed by subsection (a) according to a specified table. The tax amount per ton for various substances is as follows:
- Acetylene: $11.00
- Benzene: $11.00
- Butane: $11.00
- Butylene: $11.00
- Butadiene: $11.00
- Ethylene: $11.00
- Methane: $7.77
- Napthalene: $11.00
- Propylene: $11.00 The tax amount per ton for various substances is as follows:
- Propylene: 11.00
- Toluene: 11.00
- Xylene: 11.00
- Ammonia: 5.96
- Antimony: 10.05
- Antimony trioxide: 8.47
- Arsenic: 10.05
- Arsenic trioxide: 7.70
- Barium sulfide: 5.19
- Bromine: 10.05
- Cadmium: 10.05
- Chlorine: 6.10
- Chromium: 10.05 The tax amount per ton for various substances includes Chromium at 10.05, Chromite at 3.43, Potassium dichromate at 3.82, Sodium dichromate at 4.22, Cobalt at 10.05, Cupric sulfate at 4.22, Cupric oxide at 8.11, Cuprous oxide at 8.96, Hydrochloric acid at 0.65, Hydrogen fluoride at 9.55, Lead oxide at 9.35, Mercury at 10.05, and Nickel at 10.05. The tax amount per ton for various substances includes Stannous chloride at 6.43, Stannic chloride at 4.79, Zinc chloride at 5.01, Zinc sulfate at 4.29, Potassium hydroxide at 0.50, Sodium hydroxide at 0.63, Sulfuric acid at 0.59, and Nitric acid at 0.54. For taxable years starting after December 31, 2014, dollar amounts in the table are adjusted for inflation based on the cost-of-living adjustment for the calendar year. If the increase is not a multiple of $0.01, it is rounded down. The amendments made by this section apply to oil and petroleum products received or entered during calendar quarters beginning more than 60 days after the date of the enactment of this Act. The definition of crude oil for excise tax purposes is clarified to include various oil derivatives. The amendment applies to oil and petroleum products received after 60 days from the enactment of the Act. Additionally, the use of the Hazardous Substance Superfund for cleanup is addressed. The Hazardous Substance Superfund under the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 is amended to make funds available without further appropriation for specified purposes. The use of the fund for cleanup is addressed. The Hazardous Substance Superfund is amended to provide funds for cleanup purposes without the need for further appropriation. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code include changes related to the Superfund Polluter Pays Restoration Act of 2014.
